mil3.7.7:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil3.7.7:1.2_0: “Which of those who have made merit or more merit?”
mil3.7.7:1.3_0: “Having made much bad karma, great king.”
mil3.7.7:1.5_0: “Great king, if you make merit and regrets it, but I’ve done nothing wrong.
mil3.7.7:1.6_0: Your merit is joyful. Being joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.
mil3.7.7:1.7_0: A man gave him one piece of cloth, but not in one robe. After giving the Buddha one sitting mat, he won’t go forth, and not obtain it.
mil3.7.7:1.8_0: That’s because I’ve made much bad karma for the sake of this reason.”
